intro: Sobralia imavieirae, commonly known as the Iavieira's sobralia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its flowers are often fragrant and display a variety of hues, including shades of yellow, orange, and red. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sobralia imavieirae is considered a rare and endangered species.
